_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Environmental Protection Agency Risk Management Plan

Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit Enterprise Products Operating LLC. 

Risk Management Plan (RMP)

Executive Summary



At Enterprise, we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes (especially those using hazardous substances) in a safe and responsible manner.  We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency response planning programs to help ensure the safety of our employees and the public as well as protection of the environment.  This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented, including:



* A description of our facility and use of substances required by EPA's RMP regulation and the processes involved

* Emergency Response Programs

* General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

* A five-year accident history for accidental releases of chemicals at the Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit that are regulated by EPAA's RMP rule.  



Facility Description



The Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit located in Chambers County, Texas is owned by Enterprise Products Operating LLC and is operated by Enterprise.

The Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit is a processing facility designed to remove entrained gases from a stream of natural gasoline that has been treated in a process to oxidize any mercaptans in the stream to disulfides.  The gasoline stream is heated and sent to a stripping tower where heated gasoline vapors are used to strip the gases from the gasoline.   The degassed gasoline product is sent to pipeline storage facilities.  The gases exiting from the top of the stripping tower are refrigerated to condense most of the hydrocarbon vapors into a liquid product that is returned to the degassing process.  The stripped gases and remaining trace hydrocarbons are sent to a thermal oxidizer for combustion of nay non-condensed hydrocarbons.



The Plant is sub

ject to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation and is classified as a Program Level 1 site under the EPA RMP program.



Toxics



No toxic materials to report.



Flammables



The Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit was evaluated to determine if any regulated flammable or toxic substances exceeded the threshold quantity.  Enterprise identified the regulated substances and quantities kept on site based on process knowledge.  Listed flammable substances which are present above the threshold quantities at the Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit include the gasoline stream containing a small amount of normal butane, plus significant amounts of normal pentane and isopentane.  Refrigerant grade propane is also used at the facility in the refrigeration system, but is present below the threshold quantity covered by the Risk Management Program regulation.



Offsite Consequence Analysis Results



The offsite consequence analysis will not be reflected in the executive summary but rather is reflected in the data components.  There are flammable substances on site and no toxic substances above the threshold quantity.



General Accidental Release Prevention Program



The following is a summary of the accidental release prevention program in place at Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit and Storage.  The process at the facility is regulated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Risk Management Program (RMP) regulation (Program 1).  Release prevention is provided through the use of written operating procedures, employee training in written procedures, including normal operation and emergency release procedures, and in the design of safety and release prevention equipment installed at the terminal site.  In addition, a written safety program designed to comply with all applicable OSHA safety performance regulations is strictly enforced at all Enterprise facilities, including the Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit and Storage

facility.  As part of the Enterprise safety program, the facility utilizes procedures that are included in the Enterprise program, but may not specifically be required at non-PSM and/or RMP Program 1 facilities (e.g. Safe work practice training; safe work permitting and hot work permitting).



Universal Prevention Activities



The accident prevention program summarized previously is applied to all RMP covered processes at Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit.  Collectively, these prevention program activities help prevent potential accident scenarios that could be caused by equipment failures and human errors.



Specialized Safety Features



Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit has safety features on many units to help contain/control a release, to quickly detect a release and reduce the consequence of a release.  The following types of safety features are used in the covered processes:



Release Detection



* Hydrocarbon (hazardous gas) detectors and alarms

* Fire detectors on gas compression equipment

* Plant video surveillance system



Release Containment and Control



* Process relief valves that discharge to a flare to capture and incinerate episodic releases

* Valves to permit isolation of the process (manual or automated).

* Automatic shutdown systems for specific process parameters (e.g., high pressure).

* Secondary containment (curbs and dikes) to contain any release of liquid chemicals

* Redundant equipment and instrumentation where advisable

* Dual mechanical seals with seal failure alarms installed on hydrocarbon liquid pumps.

* Atmospheric relief devices



Release Mitigation



* Hand-held and wheeled cart fire extinguishers

* Personnel trained in emergency response and procedures.

* Personnel protective equipment (e.g., chemical protective clothing, hard hats, safety glasses, etc.)



Emergency Response Program



Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit maintains a written emergency procedure, which is in place to protect worker and public safety as w

ell as the environment.  The procedures are for the possibility of a fire or explosion if a flammable substance is accidentally released.  The procedures address notification of local emergency response agencies if a release occurs.  Employees receive training in emergency procedures.  The emergency procedure is updated when necessary based on modifications made to the plant facilities.



The overall emergency procedure program for Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit is coordinated with the Mutual Aid Mont Belvieu response organization (MAMB).  This coordination includes periodic meetings of the committee, which includes response officials from local industries, the Mont Belvieu Police Department, the Mont Belvieu Fire Department, Emergency Medical Services and the Chambers County Emergency Management system (LEPC).  The Natural Gasoline Degassing Unit has around-the-clock communications capability with appropriate LEPC officials and emergency response organizations.  This provides a means of notifying the public of an incident, if necessary, as well as facilitating quick response to an incident.



Accident History



Records are kept for all significant accidental chemical releases that occur at our facility.  The following is a brief summary of accidental chemical releases involving materials covered under EPA's RMP rule during the past five years:



This facility has not had an accidental release in the last five years which meets the criteria set forth in 40 CFR 68.10. 



Planned Changes to Improve Safety



The following is a list of reviews and/or improvements that are planned for implementation at the facility to help prevent and/or better respond to accidental hazardous material releases:



* There are currently no changes planned for the facility that would improve safety.
